titleInfo.title: USA v. Garcia-Jimenez
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 16 Motion to Continue as to Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez (1). Jury Trial set for 1/12/2009 09:00 AM in Courtroom 1 - Lincoln before Judge Richard G. Kopf. The additional time arising as a result of the granting of the motion, the time between July 30, 2008 and January 12, 2009 shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. ( GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Garcia-Jimenez
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - Plaintiff's counsel is directed to file under restricted access the letter he received from defendant, a copy of which is attached to plaintiff's e-mail message to the undersigned on December 18, 2008. The clerk is directed to treat the letter as a motion for appointment of new counsel, and the motion is set for hearing on December 23, 2008 at 10:00 a.m. before the undersigned. Defendant shall be present at the hearing as to defendant Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. (1 Certified copy to USM)(GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Garcia-Jimenez
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - The hearing on the defendant's anticipated plea of guilty, commenced January 7, 2009, is adjourned. The motion for continuance, filing no. 36, construed as a motion to set for trial, is granted. Trial is set to commence at 9:00 a.m. on February 23, 2009, for a duration of five days before the Honorable Richard G. Kopf in Courtroom 1, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska. Jury selection will be held at commencement of trial. The time between January 13, 2009 and February 23, 2009 shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act as to Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez.Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. (GJG)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Garcia-Jimenez
titleInfo.subTitle: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE regarding motion as to defendant Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez (1). The United States' Motion for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture 47 is hereby sustained. Based upon Counts V, VI and VII of the Indictment and the Defendant's plea of guilty, the United States is hereby authorized to seize the $734.00 in United States currency, the Kel-Tec,.40 caliber pistol and the Hi Point.45 caliber pistol. The Defendant's interest in said properties is hereby forfeited to the United States for disposition in accordance with the law, subject to the provisions of 21 U.S.C., § 853(n)(1). Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 21 U.S.C., § 853(n), in which all interests will be addressed. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM)(LKH)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE regarding motion as to defendant Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez (1). The United States' Motion for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture 47 is hereby sustained. Based upon Counts V, VI and VII of the Indictment and the Defendant's plea of guilty, the United States is hereby authorized to seize the $734.00 in United States currency, the Kel-Tec,.40 caliber pistol and the Hi Point.45 caliber pistol. The Defendant's interest in said properties is hereby forfeited to the United States for disposition in accordance with the law, subject to the provisions of 21 U.S.C., § 853(n)(1). Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 21 U.S.C., § 853(n), in which all interests will be addressed. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM)(LKH)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Garcia-Jimenez
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez. It is ordered that:... (2)There are no disputed matters regarding the presentence report and the proper computation of the advisory Guidelines ranges.(3)Except to the extent (if at all) that I have sustained an objection or granted a motion or reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects. ETC. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Garcia-Jimenez
titleInfo.subTitle: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order of Forfeiture, filing 53 is hereby sustained. All right, title and interest in and to the $734.00 in United States Currency, a Kel-Tec,.40 caliber pistol, and a Hi Point.45 caliber pistol, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The $734.00 in United States Currency, a Kel-Tec,.40 caliber pistol, and a Hi Point.45 caliber pistol, be, and the same hereby are, forfeited to the United States of America. The United States Marshal for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of said properties in accordance with law as to Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM)(GJG)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order of Forfeiture, filing 53 is hereby sustained. All right, title and interest in and to the $734.00 in United States Currency, a Kel-Tec,.40 caliber pistol, and a Hi Point.45 caliber pistol, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The $734.00 in United States Currency, a Kel-Tec,.40 caliber pistol, and a Hi Point.45 caliber pistol, be, and the same hereby are, forfeited to the United States of America. The United States Marshal for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of said properties in accordance with law as to Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM)(GJG)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Garcia-Jimenez
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to defendant Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez (1). DEFENDANT pleaded guilty to counts I, II, III, V, VI, and VII of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for seventy-eight (78) months as to Counts I through III, said terms to run concurrent; five (5) years supervised release with special conditions as to Count I, and three (3) years supervised release with special conditions as to Counts II and III, said terms to run concurrent; $300.00 special assessment. Count IV of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only. Final order of forfeiture filed on 06/02/09 as to Counts V, VI, and VII. The defendant shall forfeit the defendants interest in the following property to the United States: a Kel-Tec.40 caliber pistol as to Count V, a Hi Point.45 caliber pistol as to Count VI, $734.00 in U.S. currency as to Count VII. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 Certified copies to USM)(LKH)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to defendant Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez (1). DEFENDANT pleaded guilty to counts I, II, III, V, VI, and VII of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for seventy-eight (78) months as to Counts I through III, said terms to run concurrent; five (5) years supervised release with special conditions as to Count I, and three (3) years supervised release with special conditions as to Counts II and III, said terms to run concurrent; $300.00 special assessment. Count IV of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only. Final order of forfeiture filed on 06/02/09 as to Counts V, VI, and VII. The defendant shall forfeit the defendants interest in the following property to the United States: a Kel-Tec.40 caliber pistol as to Count V, a Hi Point.45 caliber pistol as to Count VI, $734.00 in U.S. currency as to Count VII. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 Certified copies to USM)(LKH)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Garcia-Jimenez
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez. It is ordered that:(1)Counsel for the government shall notify the court when the motion for reduction in sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) 63 is ripe for decision. The motion shall not be decided until counsel for the government certifies that the motion is ripe;(2)Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant until the Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw;(3)The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher;(4)The Clerk of the Court shall provide a copy of this order to counsel for the government and counsel for the defendant. The undersigned's judicial assistant will provide a copy to the Federal Public Defender. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. ( KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER as to Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez. It is ordered that:(1)Counsel for the government shall notify the court when the motion for reduction in sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) 63 is ripe for decision. The motion shall not be decided until counsel for the government certifies that the motion is ripe;(2)Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant until the Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw;(3)The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher;(4)The Clerk of the Court shall provide a copy of this order to counsel for the government and counsel for the defendant. The undersigned's judicial assistant will provide a copy to the Federal Public Defender. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. ( KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Garcia-Jimenez
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Eliseo Garcia-Jimenez. It is ordered that: (1)The government's request for hearing 65 is granted.(2)A hearing on the government's motion for reduction of sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) 63 has been set before the undersigned United States district judge on Wednesday, March 14, 2012, at 12:30 p.m, in Courtroom No. 1, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska.(3)At the request of the defendant through his counsel, the defendant will participate in the hearing by telephone.(4)The Marshal is directed not to return the defendant to the district.(5)The defendant is held to have waived his right to be present. Ordered by Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

Ordered by Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )
